I didn't mean that we never had colonies, or gave them up for moral reasons But indeed, as you pointed out, we never faced the problems associated with independence, decolonisation etc. As for the brief colonial period we had exclusively before the first world war , its organisation was a bit different from the rest of the colonial powers. State influence and interest was low, the colonies were mainly managed by merchants. Even the colonial armies (the "Schutztruppen") were the equivalent of Blackwater: private mercenaries and police forces, headed by a few actual officers (with the exception of Namibia). Ties to the motherland were few, even economically.
